ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Writing in Spanish is a good course for students highly dedicated to learning Spanish syntax, widening their vocabulary, and reviewing complex grammar concepts. The workload is very manageable, but you will be able to make significant improvements nonetheless. However, the course is really what you make of it. If you do not dedicate the time and energy to reviewing your mistakes and actively widening your vocabulary, you will not improve much. So I would recommend this course to dedicated students only.

Writing in Spanish is a basic overview of writing styles (like autobiography, expository, descriptive, argumentative). I feel that my writing somewhat improved through the numerous exercises. IT was a bit tiresome to go through the whole editing rough draft process for every assignment, but I don't regret taking the class. The professor is awesome and seriously one of the nicest people I have met at Yale. She is extremely hardworking, knowledgeable and full of interesting stories to tell. I'd definitely recommend a course with her!
